text: Kasper Kaan Kairinen (born 22 December 1998) is a Finnish footballer currently playing for 1. divisjon club Lillestrøm SK on loan from FC Midtjylland. He was born to a Turkish father and a Finnish mother in Turku.Interin Kairiselta odotetaan ihmeitä Turun Sanomat == Club career == ===FC Inter Turku=== Kairinen is a youth exponent from FC Inter Turku. He made his Veikkausliiga debut at 25 October 2014 against FF Jaro, coming on as a substitute for Kalle Kauppi after 70 minutes in a 0-1 home defeat. Kairinen became the second- youngest player in Inter Turku’s history to play for the club, since he made his debut at the age of 15.The Guardian ===FC Midtjylland=== On 1 February 2016, it was confirmed by FC Midtjylland, that they had signed with Kairinen.FCM sikrer sig finsk midtbanetalent, fcm.dk, 1 February 2016 On 14 November 2018, Midtjylland announced that Kairinen would spend 2019 at HJK Helsinki on a loan deal.Kaan Kairinen udlejes til den finske mesterklub, fcm.dk, 14 November 2018 ==International== He made his debut for the Finland national football team on 8 January 2019 in a friendly against Sweden, as a 54th-minute substitute for Rasmus Schüller. == Style of play == ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Finnish footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Finland youth international footballers Category:Finland under-21 international footballers Category:Finland international footballers Category:FC Inter Turku players Category:Helsingin Jalkapalloklubi players Category:Veikkausliiga players Category:Finnish people of Turkish descent Category:Sportspeople from Turku
title: Kaan Kairinen
